result.markdown:
--- title: "Lab Team" subtitle: "Meet the researchers driving our science" toc: true toc-depth: 2 --- ## Principal Investigator

Li Zhang

Principal Investigator

Dr. Li Zhang is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Poultry Science specializing in molecular microbiology, pathogen genomics, and food safety. His research focuses on developing vaccines against avian pathogenic E. coli and Campylobacter jejuni, rapid molecular diagnostic tools, and understanding the poultry gut microbiome. He has secured over $4 million in research funding as PI and published 67+ peer-reviewed articles.

Education
  • Ph.D. in Nutrition, Mississippi State University, 2017
  • Ph.D. in Agriculture Biological Environmental & Energy Engineering, Jilin University, China, 2013
  • M.S. in Agricultural Product Processing & Storage Engineering, Northeast Agricultural University, China, 2005
  • B.S. in Food Science and Engineering, Northeast Agricultural University, China, 2002
--- ## Postdoctoral Researchers *No current postdocs. [Positions available!](join.qmd)* --- ## Graduate Students

Sunita Shrestha

Ph.D. Student

Research: Poultry pathogen genomics and vaccine development

Expected: 2027

Sunita is a Ph.D. student working on pathogen genomics and vaccine development strategies for poultry pathogens. She was a 2025 Lallemand Animal Nutrition Scholarship Finalist.

Manhong Wang

Ph.D. Student

Research: Culturomics and poultry gut microbiome analysis

Expected: 2026

Manhong is a Ph.D. student developing culturomics approaches to isolate and characterize beneficial bacteria from the poultry gut microbiome. He received the 2024 International Paper Scholarship from the Mississippi Poultry Association.

Rita Ugoh

M.S. Student

Research: Catfish spoilage bacteria characterization

Expected: 2026

Rita is an M.S. student working on characterizing spoilage bacteria in catfish using culturomics approaches.

Haley Nabors

M.S. Student

Research: Clostridium perfringens antimicrobial resistance

Expected: 2025

Haley is an M.S. student investigating antibiotic resistance patterns in Clostridium perfringens isolated from diseased chickens.

Hailey Fugate

M.S. Student

Research: APEC vaccine validation and Campylobacter challenge models

Expected: Fall 2025

Hailey is an M.S. student working on validating vaccine candidates against avian pathogenic E. coli and optimizing Campylobacter colonization challenge models. She received the 2025 SCAD and IPPE Travel Awards.

--- ## Undergraduate Researchers

Sulav Jung Thapa

Undergraduate Researcher

Research: AI-based health monitoring in poultry farms

Sulav is an undergraduate researcher working on image recognition and processing using OpenMV modules for health and disease monitoring in farms. He received the 2024 USDA ARS summer internship and ORED URCD award.

Zoe Lohf

Undergraduate Researcher

Research: Laboratory research assistant

Zoe joined the lab in 2025 as an undergraduate research assistant.

Keaura Mearday

Undergraduate Researcher

Research: Laboratory research assistant

Keaura joined the lab in 2025 as an undergraduate research assistant.
